Name: Drama
Description: The drama genre features stories with high stakes and a lot of conflicts. They are plot-driven and demand that every character and scene move the story forward.

Name: Fantasy
Description: Films in the fantasy genre feature magical and supernatural elements that do not exist in the real world. Some films may take place in a real-world setting, but create many imaginary universes with their own laws, logic, and populations of imaginary races and creatures.

Name: Action
Description: Movies in the action genre are fast-paced and include a lot of action like fight scenes, chases scenes, and slow-motion shots. They can fature superheroes, martial arts, or exciting stunts. These high-octane films are more about the execution of the plot rather than the plot itself. Action movies are meant to be thrilling to watch and leave audience members on the edge of their seats.

Name: Adventure
Description: Films in the adventure genre usually contain the same basic genre elements of an action movie, but with a focus on the setting. Adventure movies are usually set in exotic, far away, or unfamiliar locations.

Name: Sci-fi
Description: Science fiction (or sci-fi) is a film genre that uses speculative, fictional science-based depictions of phenomena that are not fully accepted by mainstream science, such as extraterrestrial lifeforms, spacecraft, robots, cyborgs, interstellar travel or other technologies.
